poem:
Title: A Reverie in Stained Glass

In dawn's quietude, a nun pens her divine claim -
Her soul stirs like unpicked clover beneath the sun.
Father, she whispers through ink, I have seen the holy flame,
Through the clamor, a whisper of encouragement won.
A letter, a vision, a change worth the name -
These the vessel of inspiration, by the heaven spun.
